(44) 442.Vltli August, 1944.WAR CABINET.COMMITTEE ON COMMERCIAL POLICY SCHEME.Minute by the Prime Minister.AT their meeting on Tuesday, the 18th July, the War Cabinet invited me to set up a small Cabinet committee of four or five Ministers, to examinethe questions raised by the Commercial Policy Scheme, with particular regardto the position of agriculture and the provisions of bulk purchase thereunder.Having regard to the far-reaching political issues involved, I have reachedthe conclusion that the membership of this committee should have special regard to the main political parties in the Government and should be asfollows : Chancellor of the Exchequer (in the Chair).Lord President of the Council.Secretary of State for Dominion Affairs.Secretary of State for Air.Minister of Education.A number of departmental Ministers have of course a very direct interestin this matter, in particular the President of the Board of Trade, Minister ofAgriculture and Fisheries, Secretary of State for Scotland and the Ministerof Food. These Ministers and others concerned will, of course, be invited toattend meetings and given ample opportunities, not only to put forward theirown proposals, but also to express their views on other proposals put beforethe Committee.(Intd.) W. S. C.10 Downing Street, S.W. 1,VUh August, 1944.279S3
